snippet: Under regional recalls, carmakers limit notification and repairs to specific states or regions based on factors, like extreme heat, that cause a part to fail.
abstract: Consumer advocacy groups says regional recalls by automakers, which limit notification and repairs to specific states or regions based on factors that cause part to fail, leave some defective and dangerous vehicles on the road; General Motors and other carmakers argue it makes no sense to repair vehicles elsewhere, and federal safety officials typically go along.
lead_paragraph: Under regional recalls, carmakers limit notification and repairs to specific states or regions based on factors, like extreme heat, that cause a part to fail.

headline.main: General Motors’ Fuel Pump Recall Reveals Patchwork Approach to Auto Safety
headline.print_headline: Regional Recalls Are Said to Leave Defective Autos on the Road
